channel.title: Server security analysis study
channel.description:
One thing I've wondered about, is the security of the people around here, especially on hamachi. Because hamachi enables full lan access, computers on it are open targets. ;) No-ip isn't as much a problem, because most are shielded by a firewall/NAT router. But hamachi, most people allow the netbios ports, which are the nastier ones for 'security auditers'. *cough* ;)
So, I decided to start some simple vanilla scanning (hamachi must not allow syn stealth scans) on networks I find in the advertisement section.
[b]*NOTE: I am NOT compromising systems, I am JUST compiling an anonymous listing of open ports/services on people's computers on hamachi*[/b] [img]http://my.hamachi.cc/status/image.php?5.59.125.53[/img] My hamachi ip is 5.59.125.53, so if you see any scanning from that, either ignore or block me, but don't go whining, as what I am doing is 100% legal. I'm just scanning, no compromising whatsoever.
Now for results, I will post nmap scans in different posts (with identifying/unneeded items removed). [b] All will be formatted: Ip (anonymous) Open ports: Port State Service Version Possible Os[/b][br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 09:19:37 PM[/size][hr]Note: People are welcome to help me ;)
5.80.112.* 135/tcp open msrpc Microsoft Windows RPC Service Info: OS: Windows [br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 09:20:03 PM[/size][hr]5.96.138.1* 1025/tcp open
(Things ommitted are because they were unknown, or scan stopped abruptly due to my time limits)[br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 09:22:56 PM[/size][hr]5.107.82.121 1025/tcp open NFS-or-IIS?

item.title: Server security analysis study
item.dc:creator: @Phonecheck Phonecheck
item.description:
@Phonecheck wrote:

[quote=“superstuntguy, post:4, topic:40599”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=56900.msg703127#msg703127 date=1167388336]
You scan me I will ping you until your ISP is bankrupt.
[/quote]
…
Lol, ping! Pong!
Anyways, my router disregards all pings
And unless you’re running a botnet (naughty you) I doubt you have the ability to flood me.

why would anyone wanna do this?To hack?

No, Its a study, maybe if you had actually read it you would get it.[/quote]
I will never take my time and read a useless topic.This is NOT benifiting the rs private server community at all.Your scanning peoples ip without their consent.

Read full topic

@superstuntguy wrote:

One thing I’ve wondered about, is the security of the people around here, especially on hamachi.
Because hamachi enables full lan access, computers on it are open targets.
No-ip isn’t as much a problem, because most are shielded by a firewall/NAT router.
But hamachi, most people allow the netbios ports, which are the nastier ones for ‘security auditers’.
cough

So, I decided to start some simple vanilla scanning (hamachi must not allow syn stealth scans) on networks I find in the advertisement section.

NOTE: I am NOT compromising systems, I am JUST compiling an anonymous listing of open ports/services on people’s computers on hamachi

My hamachi ip is 5.59.125.53, so if you see any scanning from that, either ignore or block me, but don’t go whining, as what I am doing is 100% legal.
I’m just scanning, no compromising whatsoever.

Now for results, I will post nmap scans in different posts (with identifying/unneeded items removed).

All will be formatted:

Open ports:
Port State Service Version
